title: Is there any device that makes a wireless internet connection wired? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, it’s called a wireless bridge. It connects to an existing WiFi network, and then provides physical ethernet ports to hardwire other stuff to. I’ve used this one in the past, and it works exactly like you’d expect. Most router/access point combo units have this functionality built-in.

As Alex Manchester stated: The device is called a wireless bridge.You configure it to connect to the wifi ssid then plug an ethernet cable into it. A travel router will have this functionality built in, many routers off the shelf have this ability (like nearly any model made by asus). Any router can be converted to a wireless bridge if you can install openwrt, dd-wrt or tomato to it.
